Publisher

  • Publisher
    • MessagePublisher

MessagePublisher

MessagePublisher can publish messages to multiple topics. If topic does not exist, it will be created. The published message data will be Base-64 encoded on the file system. See the Publisher API for more details.

A concrete publisher can be created using the Publisher Factory API.

From 4.1.1 release onwards, MessagePublisher does not support in publishing the large messages(which are having more than 50KB).

We have two variants of scribe publishers. ScribeMessagePublisher which is an async publsiher where as ScribeBlockingMessagePublsihe is a Blocking publisher, which will be blocked on in-memory queue if the in-memory queue is not having enough space.

Usage

Users will have to add compile time dependency to the maven artifact of the messaging-client-core as follows. See available Maven artifacts for version numbers.

<dependency>
<groupId>com.inmobi.messaging</groupId>
<artifactId>messaging-client-core</artifactId>
<version>${messaging-client-version}\</version>
</dependency>

For publishing messages to Databus

  • Add the runtime dependency to messaging-client-scribe as follows. See Maven artifacts for available versions.
<dependency>
<groupId>com.inmobi.messaging</groupId>
<artifactId>messaging-client-scribe</artifactId>
<version>${messaging-client-version}</version>
<scope>runtime</scope>
</dependency>

Configuration

The publisher factory reads the publisher configuration from a file named messaging-publisher-conf.properties. See sample configuration at messaging-publisher-conf.properties. The available configuration properties are described Here.

Topic Selector

This is a utility for selecting a topic bases on the message. Basically, it routes the message to a topic on which it has to publish. click here for the example code snippets of topic selector and configuration settings for the publisher.
